alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:35PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Appomattox and south central Buckingham Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hixburg, or 10 miles east of Appomattox, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pamplin City... and Hixburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain, with rates up to three to four inches per hour, will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
